qas.question: What law gave Somali husbands and wives equal rights over personal property?
What was the official name of the country in which the 1975 Somali Family Law was passed?
In addition to giving spouses equal rights over their personal property during marriage, what did the Somali Family Law give them?

answers.text: equal division of property between the husband and wife upon divorce

context: In 1975, the most prominent government reforms regarding family law in a Muslim country were set in motion in <a1_0>the Somali Democratic Republic<a1_0/>, which put women and men, including husbands and wives, on complete equal footing. The <a0_0>1975 Somali Family Law<a0_0/> gave men and women <a2_0>equal division of property between the husband and wife upon divorce<a2_0/> and the exclusive right to control by each spouse over his or her personal property.
